metadata.Title: CVE-2021-38504 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
When interacting with an HTML input element's file picker dialog with webkitdirectory set, a use-after-free could have resulted, leading to memory corruption and a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 94, Thunderbird < 91.3, and Firefox ESR < 91.3.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-38504` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 94.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:91.3.1+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.3.1+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.3.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.3.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.3.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.3.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine
